captions.text:
You're finally gonna do
something right.

Hey, crybaby!
Trying to move pillows here!

Get some some sleep this time
all right, buddy?

- I can't believe
we're doing this.

- Let me just getcha
right over here.

- Are you ready
for my big surprise?

- And none of
the kittens survived.

In other news,
The Delberry Dismemberer

is on the loose again
and so far...

Get your running shoes on, folks
and if you hear a chainsaw

- And your neck is broken, and
pretty much everything else too.

Long story short, Larry, you're
very lucky to be alive.

Now is there anything else
I can do for you?

- Run for your lives!
It's the Delberry Dismemberer!

title: Sad, Sad Larry - Cyanide & Happiness Shorts

comments.text:
I'm afraid I can't allow you to do that, Larry.  You used to be a very bad 
person, spent 800years in hell before you got this chance.  Here is how 
this is going to work:  You're going to live.  You're going to feel every 
color of pain in the rainbow, and even though I'm always breathing down 
your neck you are never going to be able to end your own life.

Fuck you, Larry.

---Eternally yours, Death﻿
comments.author: Jones Crimson

comments.text:
I 'worship'-- sloppy and imprecise word-- myself, so I guess we're a bit 
different in that regard.

The universe just is, but we have the ability to do anything we want in it.
So I 'worship' my ability to change it.

And everyone else?  Possible liabilities; I can't control them, but I can 
create contingency responses to anything stupid they might do.

I'm agnostic, too.
I leave the after-life speculation to the deceased and worry about life 
while I'm alive--
ergo, the whole 'worshiping' myself thing.

I am the Architect, of course.  I made the Matrix.
comments.author: manictiger

comments.text:
+manictiger I have three very well thought-through answers for you, pick 
whichever you like best:

#1 *LOGICAL* It's easier to control people for a few millennium if you 
claim their succumbing to animal urge and tribalism will send them straight 
to eternal suffering.

#2 *MADNESS IN ALL THINGS* If there is an omnipotent god whose mere 
thoughts warp existence, then he conceives that each and every one of us 
exist and therefor we do.  When you're so sure that something exists 
erasure is impossible, because the feeling that they were once here and 
therefore still are in some eerie way is impossible to remedy.

#3 *SPIRITUAL* Eternity is nothing for a god, and those in hell who realize 
their sins can still beg for forgiveness.  He's basically waiting on an 
investment to pay off so he can bring them back to the light.

Personally, any form of eternal unchanging existence sounds like torture to 
me.  If I had to say I worshiped anything it would be the chaos and chance 
that is science.  Agnostic is my choice of word, because the only correct 
answer is that we do not know.
comments.author: Jones Crimson

comments.text:
If you think about it too much, it makes you wonder how 'good' god can be 
if that hell thing is true.

Consider:
Mentally ruining and torturing a person for eternity...
Or just quickly and permanently killing them...

Which is the less sadistic and evil option?
